intro: Acetosella tenera, commonly known as mouse ear chickweed, is a low-growing perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. The plant produces tiny white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters at the tips of the stems. Acetosella tenera is typically found in moist, rocky soils and is often seen in woodland or meadow habitats. It is a hardy plant that thrives in temperate climates and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening for its delicate foliage.
